replies.msg:
Ask me anything
I am a native HK-er in his early 30s

Hello from America!

- Can you recommend some restaurants for my next trip to HK? I eat almost every type of cuisine. I prefer small, simple local restaurants.

- Do you have any expat friends? If so, are they fluent in Cantonese?

- If you could travel anywhere, where would you go?

quote.msg:

replies.msg:
U should go cha chaan teng (local restaurant) and they r everywhere. Some of them are famous. (e.g. 澳牛(just search it in Google)) Of course there r many food from different parts of the world. U can easily search them and it's usually convenient to go from a place to another.

No need to worry about language barrier, most HKers can communicate in simple English. (though not fluent) Feel free to ask ppl Qs on the street. (Usually u may feel unwelcoming by looking at their impatient face, but it’s a typical appearance of standard HKers and they do not mean to give u a poker face or impatient face)

replies.msg: Chinese is simple in grammar (almost non-existent), but you need to memorise the characters. Cantonese is a tonal language so be sure not to use the wrong tones or else you’ll be saying a completely different character (we can sometimes guess what you’re trying to say from the context if you make some mistakes). I think most westerners have trouble with the tones.

quote.msg: how big is your kitchen?

replies.msg: A really petite one. I have everything I need though.

replies.msg:
There are a lot of food you could try in HK, after all HK has been crowned as the food paradise for long. What are you particularly fond of?

I studied abroad for a while and acquainted friends literally all over the world. There are still some we are meeting each other from time to time.
Sadly none of them speaks Cantonese. I taught them a couple of phrases, and it seemed they find it difficult to deal with those tones. Yes, Cantonese has nine tones and just one minor change could make things totally different.

I have a tendency of going back to places I have linkages. Barcelona would be on the top of the list.
